meanings.definition: A person who is slow or lazy in doing things.
meanings.sent1: The dawdlers at the back of the line took their time walking to school.
meanings.sent2: The group of friends were known as the dawdlers because they always arrived late.
meanings.sent3: The dawdlers in the race stopped to tie their shoes multiple times.
meanings.sent4: The dawdlers in the office made the workday feel like a never-ending journey.
meanings.sent5: The dawdlers in the park seemed to move in slow motion, enjoying every moment.

meanings.definition: To waste time or be slow in doing something.
meanings.sent1: Please don't dawdle on your way to the store; we're running out of time.
meanings.sent2: The children tend to dawdle when it's time to clean up their toys.
meanings.sent3: I always dawdle when I have to do chores, finding any excuse to delay.
meanings.sent4: The cat likes to dawdle around the house, exploring every nook and cranny.
meanings.sent5: If you dawdle too much, you might miss the opportunity to see the sunset.
